item.title: 澳大利亚总理对中国暂停购买必和必拓铁矿石的报道表示担忧
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞周三表示，他对有关中国国有铁矿石买家已采取措施暂停向矿商必和必拓购买铁矿石货物的报道感到担忧。【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Wednesday he was concerned about a report that China's state iron ore buyer had taken steps to pause purchases of iron ore cargoes from miner BHP .】

item.title: 解说：特朗普与辉瑞的交易对药价意味着什么？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统长期以来一直认为美国为处方药支付的费用超过了其应有的水平，他周二表示，辉瑞公司已同意降低其向美国低收入人群医疗补助计划（Medicaid）销售的药品价格，并确保美国不会为新药支付比其他高收入国家更高的费用。特朗普表示，他希望其他制药商也能效仿。【原文：President Donald Trump, who has long argued that the U.S. pays more than it should for prescription medicines, on Tuesday said Pfizer had agreed to cut prices for drugs it sells to the Medicaid program for low-income Americans and to ensure the U.S. would not pay more for new medicines than other high-income nations. Trump said he expects other drugmakers to follow suit.】

item.title: 尽管季度末美联储流动性机制需求不旺，但回购利率攀升
item.description: 本周二，随着第三季度的结束，华尔街对美联储流动性工具的兴趣远低于预期，尽管回购利率的攀升显示出一定的流动性压力。【原文：Federal Reserve liquidity facilities saw much less interest from Wall Street than expected on Tuesday as the third quarter came to a close, though a climb in repo rates showed some liquidity pressure.】

item.title: 美联储罗根：美国可能需要就业市场更加宽松才能实现 2% 的通胀率
item.description: 达拉斯联储主席洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）周二表示，美国劳动力市场可能需要进一步疲软，美联储才能实现2%的通胀目标，因为在不考虑新的进口关税影响的情况下，物价上涨速度更快。【原文：The U.S. labor market likely needs to weaken further for the Federal Reserve to achieve its 2% inflation target, as prices are rising even faster without factoring in the impact of new import tariffs, Dallas Fed President Lorie Logan said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国在工人签证会议上表示鼓励韩国投资
item.description: 美国国务院表示，美国和韩国正密切合作推进两国的贸易和投资伙伴关系，包括为合格的韩国工人办理适当的签证。【原文：The U.S. and South Korea are working closely to advance their trade and investment partnership including by processing appropriate visas for qualified South Korean workers, the U.S. State Department said.】

item.title: 韩国总统将于周三会见 OpenAI 首席执行官
item.description: 韩国总统办公室表示，OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）周三计划会见韩国总统李在明，李在明希望通过促进人工智能投资的政策来推动亚洲第四大经济体的发展。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Sam Altman on Wednesday plans to meet with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung, who seeks to boost Asia's fourth-biggest economy through a policy of boosting investment in artificial intelligence, the presidential office has said.】

item.title: 新西兰政府支持能源公司的关键基础设施投资
item.description: 新西兰政府周三表示，将为本国能源公司在关键电力基础设施方面的投资提供财政支持。【原文：The New Zealand government said on Wednesday that it would financially support investment by the country’s energy companies in critical electricity infrastructure.】

item.title: 电子邮件称，美国消费者监督机构基本关闭，将在停摆期间继续工作
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一封电子邮件，美国最高消费者财务监督机构周二告诉工作人员，如果政府在午夜后关门，该机构将继续运作。【原文：The top U.S. watchdog agency for consumer finances told staff on Tuesday it will continue to operate in the event of a government shutdown after midnight, according to an email seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 苹果、谷歌和 Meta 必须面对赌场式赌博应用程序的诉讼
item.description: 一名联邦法官周二驳回了苹果公司、谷歌公司和 Meta Platforms 公司提出的驳回诉讼的请求，这些公司声称它们通过托管和接受赌场式应用程序的佣金，使用户上瘾，从而助长了非法赌博。【原文：A federal judge on Tuesday denied Apple , Google and Meta Platforms' requests to dismiss lawsuits claiming they promoted illegal gambling by hosting and accepting commissions from casino-style apps that addict users.】

item.title: 美国机构起诉苹果公司涉嫌歧视犹太工人
item.description: 美国负责执行工作场所反歧视法的机构周二起诉苹果公司，称一家零售店的经理在解雇一名犹太裔员工之前发表了反犹太言论，并拒绝了他的休假请求。【原文：The U.S. agency that enforces workplace anti-discrimination laws sued Apple on Tuesday, claiming the manager of a retail store made antisemitic comments and denied a Jewish employee's requests for time off before firing him.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国政府将持有美洲锂业公司 5%的股份，并与通用汽车成立合资企业
item.description: 一位熟悉谈判情况的消息人士称，美国能源部将持有美洲锂业公司5%的股份，以及该公司与通用汽车公司合资的Thacker Pass锂矿公司5%的股份。【原文：The U.S. Department of Energy will take a 5% stake in Lithium Americas and a separate 5% stake in the company's Thacker Pass lithium mine joint venture with General Motors , a source familiar with negotiations said.】

item.title: 据 Axios 报道，迪士尼向 Character.AI 公司发出终止信
item.description: 据 Axios 周二报道，华特迪士尼已致函 Character.AI，要求这家人工智能初创公司立即停止未经授权使用其拥有版权的角色。【原文：Walt Disney has sent a letter to Character.AI demanding that the AI startup immediately stop the unauthorized use of its copyrighted characters, Axios reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊驳回黑人工人被列入改进计划的偏见诉讼
item.description: 本周二，亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）赢得了一项诉讼的驳回，该诉讼指控这家在线零售商歧视一名黑人前雇员，减少了她的职责，并将她列入绩效改进计划。【原文：Amazon.com won the dismissal on Tuesday of a lawsuit accusing the online retailer of discriminating against a Black former employee by reducing her duties and putting her on a performance improvement plan.】

item.title: 精神航空公司在破产程序中获得高达 4.75 亿美元的融资
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）的母公司周二表示，该公司已与现有债券持有人谈判达成高达 4.75 亿美元的融资，以支持其在破产保护重组期间的正常业务运营。【原文：Spirit Airlines has negotiated funding of up to $475 million with existing bondholders to support normal business operations during its Chapter 11 restructuring, its parent company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 耐克扭亏为盈，首席执行官警告中国市场落后，未来仍需努力
item.description: 耐克周二公布第一季度营收意外增长，利润超出预期，尽管中国市场疲软和关税给利润率带来压力，但这家历史悠久的运动服饰品牌的扭亏为盈努力仍取得了进展。【原文：Nike on Tuesday reported a surprise rise in first-quarter revenue and beat profit expectations as the storied sportswear brand's turnaround effort gained traction despite weakness in China and tariffs pressuring margins.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，伯克希尔公司正在洽谈以约 100 亿美元的价格收购西方石油公司旗下的 OxyChem 公司
item.description: 华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）正在洽谈以约 100 亿美元的价格收购西方石油公司（Occidental Petroleum）的 OxyChem 石化部门。【原文：Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway is in talks to buy Occidental Petroleum's OxyChem petrochemical unit for about $10 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 从利雅得到硅谷：EA 如何成为沙特阿拉伯游戏愿景的明珠
item.description: 多年来，以技术为重点的收购集团银湖（Silver Lake）一直对视频游戏开发商电子艺界（Electronic Arts）垂涎三尺，后者是广受欢迎的《战地》（Battlefield）和《疯狂橄榄球》（Madden NFL）系列的幕后功臣。【原文：For years, tech-focused buyout group Silver Lake coveted video game developer Electronic Arts, the power behind the popular "Battlefield" and "Madden NFL" series.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会指控 Zillow 向 Redfin 支付 1 亿美元，以停止租房信息竞争
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周二在针对在线房地产平台的诉讼中表示，Zillow 涉嫌向 Redfin 支付了 1 亿美元，以停止在在线公寓租赁列表方面与其竞争。【原文：Zillow allegedly paid Redfin $100 million to stop competing against it in online apartment rental listings, the U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Tuesday in a lawsuit against the online real estate platforms.】

item.title: Meta 计划收购芯片初创公司 Rivos 以加强半导体业务
item.description: 社交媒体公司 Meta 周二表示，打算收购芯片初创公司 Rivos，以加强公司内部的半导体业务。【原文：Meta intends to acquire the chip startup Rivos to bolster its in-house semiconductor efforts, the social media company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 勒梅尔称，ASML 的 Mistral 投资可能预示着更多的欧洲科技合作
item.description: 法国前财政部长布鲁诺-勒梅尔（Bruno Le Maire）表示，荷兰芯片设备制造商ASML对法国初创公司Mistral AI的13亿欧元（15亿美元）投资，可能是欧洲分散的科技生态系统进行更多整合的开始。【原文：Dutch chip-equipment maker ASML's 1.3 billion euro ($1.5 billion) investment in French startup Mistral AI could be the start of more consolidation in the fragmented European tech ecosystem, former French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said.】

item.title: OpenAI 推出人工智能视频工具 Sora 独立应用程序
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）周二表示，OpenAI 将在美国和加拿大推出独立应用程序 Sora 2，这是一种从文字到视频的人工智能模型。【原文：OpenAI is launching Sora 2, a text-to-video artificial intelligence model, as a standalone app in the U.S. and Canada, CEO Sam Altman said on Tuesday.】

item.title: OpenAI 推出利用版权内容制作的新人工智能视频应用程序
item.description: OpenAI 正在发布一款名为 Sora 的人工智能视频生成应用程序，它可以让人们创建和分享人工智能视频，这些视频可以从版权内容中衍生出来，并分享到类似于社交媒体的信息流中。【原文：OpenAI is releasing an AI video-generating app called Sora that lets people create and share AI videos that can be spun from copyrighted content and shared to social media-like streams.】

item.title: 亚马逊更新设备阵容，整合新的人工智能设备 Alexa+
item.description: 亚马逊周二发布了针对家庭安全和新的人工智能 Alexa+ 语音助手而优化的全新设备阵容。【原文：Amazon on Tuesday unveiled a refreshed lineup of devices optimized for home security and its new artificial intelligence-infused Alexa+ voice assistant.】

item.title: 美国职位空缺温和，招聘疲软，凸显劳动力市场停滞不前
item.description: 美国 8 月份的职位空缺略有增加，而招聘人数却有所下降，这与劳动力市场的低迷状况一致，尽管消费支出有所恢复，但美联储可能会在下个月再次降息。【原文：U.S. job openings increased marginally in August while hiring declined, consistent with lackluster labor market conditions that could allow the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates again next month despite resilient consumer spending.】

item.title: LG 电子印度分公司寻求 87 亿美元的首次公开募股估值
item.description: LG 电子（印度）公司正在其拖延已久的首次公开募股中寻求最高达 7,740 亿卢比（87.1 亿美元）的估值，以今年迄今为止印度规模最大的首次公开募股之一进入熙熙攘攘的首次公开募股市场。【原文：LG Electronics India is seeking a valuation of up to 774 billion rupees ($8.71 billion) in its long-delayed initial public offering, tapping into a bustling IPO market with one of India's largest offerings so far this year.】

item.title: 人工智能编码初创公司 Vercel 融资 3 亿美元，估值 93 亿美元
item.description: 帮助开发人员构建和快速部署可扩展网站的美国云平台 Vercel 周二表示，它已在超额认购的 F 轮融资中筹集了 3 亿美元，使这家初创公司的估值达到 93 亿美元。【原文：Vercel, the U.S.-based cloud platform that helps developers build and quickly deploy scalable websites, said on Tuesday it had raised $300 million in an oversubscribed Series F round, valuing the startup at $9.3 billion.】

item.title: 阿斯利康在美国上市可能会吸引其他公司随之离开伦敦
item.description: 分析师、投资者和顾问表示，阿斯利康升级在美国上市的举动有可能导致伦敦股市的流动性减少，并可能为其他大公司效仿铺平道路。【原文：AstraZeneca’s move to upgrade its listing in the U.S. risks pulling liquidity away from London’s stock market and could pave the way for other large companies to follow suit, analysts, investors and advisers said.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片公司 Cerebras 融资 11 亿美元，与特朗普有联系的 1789 Capital 成为其投资者
item.description: 旨在通过生产餐盘大小的人工智能计算芯片来对抗英伟达（Nvidia）的硅谷初创公司Cerebras Systems周二表示，该公司已融资11亿美元，并将小唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump Jr.）担任合伙人的风险投资公司1789资本（1789 Capital）列为投资者。【原文：Cerebras Systems, a Silicon Valley startup aiming to take on Nvidia by producing a dinner-plate-sized AI computing chip, on Tuesday said it raised $1.1 billion and added 1789 Capital, the venture firm where Donald Trump Jr. is a partner, as an investor.】

item.title: CoreWeave 与 Meta 签订价值 140 亿美元的人工智能基础设施协议
item.description: CoreWeave 表示，它已与 Meta 公司签署了一项价值 140 亿美元的协议，为其提供计算能力，这是企业为满足人工智能应用需求而加强基础设施建设的最新一笔数十亿美元的交易。【原文：CoreWeave said it has signed a $14 billion agreement with Meta to supply computing power, the latest multi-billion-dollar deal as businesses ramp up infrastructure to meet the demand for artificial intelligence applications.】

item.title: Spotify 创始人埃克将卸任首席执行官，专注于长期战略
item.description: 瑞典流媒体公司 Spotify 创始人兼首席执行官丹尼尔-艾克（Daniel Ek）周二表示，Spotify 将于今年 1 月卸任执行董事长一职。【原文：Spotify founder-CEO Daniel Ek will step down to become executive chairman in January, the Swedish streaming company said on Tuesday as it adopts a new co-CEO structure in its strategy to fend off rivals and shore up its profit margin.】
